TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {44118=§ 2332 - Share-in-savings contracts, 78658=DoD, GSA, and NASA are proposing to amend the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to further implement the inflation adjustment of acquisition-related dollar thresholds. A statute requires an adjustment every five years of acquisition-related thresholds for inflation using the Consumer Price Index for all urban consumers, except for the Construction Wage Rate Requirements statute (Davis-Bacon Act), Service Contract Labor Standards statute, and trade agreements thresholds. DoD, GSA, and NASA are also proposing to use the same methodology to adjust nonstatutory FAR acquisition-related thresholds in 2015., 41699=§ 2314 - Laws inapplicable to agencies named in, 42670=§ 2323 - Contract goal for small disadvantaged businesses and certain institutions of higher education, 9683=DoD, GSA, and NASA are issuing a final rule amending the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to strengthen protections against trafficking in persons in Federal contracts. These changes are intended to implement Executive Order (E.O.) 13627, entitled “Strengthening Protections Against Trafficking in Persons in Federal Contracts,” and title XVII of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2013., 41033=§ 2309 - Allocation of appropriations, 42182=§ 2318 - Advocates for competition, 41995=§ 2316 - Disclosure of identity of contractor, 40837=§ 2307 - Contract financing, 43166=§ 2325 - Restructuring costs, 41373=§ 2312 - Remission of liquidated damages, 42381=§ 2320 - Rights in technical data, 44504=§ 2335 - Prohibition on collection of political information, 40926=§ 2308 - Buy-to-budget acquisition: end items, 41231=§ 2311 - Assignment and delegation of procurement functions and responsibilities, 73194=DoD, GSA, and NASA are proposing to amend the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to implement a section of the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) for Fiscal Year (FY) 2013 to include in the Federal Awardee Performance and Integrity Information System (FAPIIS), to the extent practicable, identification of any immediate owner or subsidiary, and all predecessors of an offeror that held a Federal contract or grant within the last three years. The objective is to provide a more comprehensive understanding of the performance and integrity of the corporation before awarding a Federal contract., 43374=§ 2327 - Contracts: consideration of national security objectives, 40398=§ 2306 - Kinds of contracts, 44388=§ 2334 - Independent cost estimation and cost analysis, 44625=§ 2336 - Intergovernmental support agreements with State and local governments, 43729=§ 2330 - Procurement of contract services: management structure, 43973=§ 2331 - Procurement of services: contracts for professional and technical services, 38569=§ 2301 - Repealed., 44765=§ 2337 - Life-cycle management and product support, 40154=§ 2305 - Contracts: planning, solicitation, evaluation, and award procedures, 41808=§ 2315 - Law inapplicable to the procurement of automatic data processing equipment and services for certain defense purposes, 43056=§ 2324 - Allowable costs under defense contracts, 39375=§ 2304 - Contracts: competition requirements, 43501=§ 2328 - Release of technical data under Freedom of Information Act: recovery of costs, 43256=§ 2326 - Undefinitized contractual actions: restrictions, 41475=§ 2313 - Examination of records of contractor, 41132=§ 2310 - Determinations and decisions, 44215=§ 2333 - Joint policies on requirements definition, contingency program management, and contingency contracting, 38649=§ 2302 - Definitions, 42476=§ 2321 - Validation of proprietary data restrictions, 42102=§ 2317 - Repealed., 42278=§ 2319 - Encouragement of new competitors, 39198=§ 2303 - Applicability of chapter, 4178=DoD, GSA, and NASA are issuing corrections to FAR Case 2013-001; Ending Trafficking in Persons (Item I), which was published in the Federal Register at 80 FR 4967, January 29, 2015., 43649=§ 2329 - Repealed., 42590=§ 2322 - Repealed.}
textBeforeTable: Additional Documents GPO FDSys XML | Text 80 FR 6908 - Federal Acquisition Regulation; Ending Trafficking in Persons; Corrections 2015-02-09; vol. 80 # 26 - Monday, February 9, 2015 For a complete list of all Rules, Proposed Rules, and Notices view the Rulemaking tab. The following are only the Rules published in the Federal Register after the published date of Title 48. Title 48 published on 2014-10-01 Prescribes contract clauses with respect to each pertinent labor law. (c) Prescribes contracting policy and procedures for implementing pertinent labor laws; and (b) Deals with general policies regarding contractor labor relations as they pertain to the acquisition process; (a) This part— 22.000 Scope of part. next prev |
textAfterTable: FAC 2005-80 Corrections DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE, GENERAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION, NATIONAL AERONAUTICS AND SPACE ADMINISTRATION Final rule; corrections. Effective: March 2, 2015. 48 CFR Parts 1, 2, 9, 12, 22, 42, and 52 Summary DoD, GSA, and NASA are issuing corrections to FAR Case 2013-001; Ending Trafficking in Persons (Item I), which was published in the Federal Register at 80 FR 4967, January 29, 2015. 2015-01-29; vol. 80 # 19 - Thursday, January 29, 2015 80 FR 4967 - Federal Acquisition Regulation; Ending Trafficking in Persons GPO FDSys XML | Text Additional Documents type regulations.gov FR Doc. 2015-01524 RIN 9000-AM55 Item I Sequence No. 1
